sentences.sContent: The party has a core of committed supporters.
sentences.sCn: 该党派有一批坚定的支持者。

sentences.sContent: I would advise people to think very carefully about committing themselves to working Sundays.
sentences.sCn: 我会建议人们认真考虑答应周日工作。

sentences.sContent: I'd like a friendship that might lead to something deeper, but I wouldn't want to commit myself too soon.
sentences.sCn: 我想要可能发展到更深层关系的友谊，但我不想太快做出承诺。

synos.tran: 坚定的；效忠的；承担义务的
承诺；委托；干坏事；付诸（commit的过去分词）

words.tran: 受委任的，受任命的；服役的，现役的
承诺，保证；委托；承担义务；献身
委员会；佣金；犯；委任；委任状
理事；委员；行政长官；总裁
委托；承担义务；赞助；收监；献身（等于commitment）
犯罪，做错事；把...交托给；指派…作战；使…承担义务

trans.tranCn: 坚定的；效忠的；承担义务的
trans.tranOther: willing to work very hard at something

trans.tranCn: 承诺；委托；干坏事；付诸（commit的过去分词）
trans.tranOther: If you commit yourself to something, you say that you will definitely do it. If you commit yourself to someone, you decide that you want to have a long-term relationship with them.
